Package easy.ease

Class EasingMethods

java.lang.Object
easy.ease.EasingMethods
public class EasingMethods extends Object
EasingMethods class provides methods for easing motion computations. It encapsulates parameters and methods related to easing functions.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    EasingMethods(float expIntensity, float totalLength, float span, float delay, float motionFrameRate)
    Constructs an instance of the EasingMethods class with specified parameters.

  • Constructor Details

    • EasingMethods

      public EasingMethods(float expIntensity, float totalLength, float span, float delay, float motionFrameRate)
      Constructs an instance of the EasingMethods class with specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      motionFrameRate - The frame rate for motion.
      expIntensity - The intensity/exponent value for easing.
      totalLength - The total length of the easing motion.
      span - The span of the easing motion.
      delay - The delay before the easing motion starts.

  • Method Details

    • setFrameRate

      public void setFrameRate(float frt)
      Sets the frame rate for motion.
      Parameters:
      frt - The frame rate to be set.

    • getFrameRate

      public float getFrameRate()
      Gets the current frame rate for motion.
      Returns:
      The current frame rate.

    • setIntensity

      public void setIntensity(float expVal)
      Sets the intensity/exponent value for the easing motion.
      Parameters:
      expVal - The new intensity/exponent value to be set.

    • getIntensity

      public float getIntensity()
      Gets the intensity/exponent value of the easing motion.
      Returns:
      The intensity/exponent value.

    • setTotalLength

      public void setTotalLength(float length)
      Sets the total length of the easing motion.
      Parameters:
      length - The new total length to be set.

    • getTotalLength

      public float getTotalLength()
      Gets the total length of the easing motion.
      Returns:
      The total length of the easing motion.

    • setSpan

      public void setSpan(float length)
      Sets the motion span of the easing motion. The motion span is the duration of the motion excluding the delay.
      Parameters:
      length - The new motion span to be set.

    • getSpan

      public float getSpan()
      Gets the motion span of the easing motion. The motion span is the duration of the motion excluding the delay.
      Returns:
      The motion span of the easing motion.

    • setDelay

      public void setDelay(float amt)
      Sets the delay of the motion. The delay is the time before the motion starts. Adjusts the motion span accordingly if needed.
      Parameters:
      amt - The new delay value to be set.

    • getDelay

      public float getDelay()
      Gets the delay of the easing motion. The delay is the time before the motion starts.
      Returns:
      The delay of the easing motion.

    • getCount

      public float getCount()
      Gets the internal counter of the easing motion in frames.
      Returns:
      The internal counter of the easing motion in frames.

    • resetCounter

      public void resetCounter()
      Set the internal counter back to 0.

    • framer

      public float framer(float input)
      converts the input value dividing it by the current frameRate.
      Parameters:
      input - the frameCount that should be converted
      Returns:
      The converted frameCount value .

    • setLog

      public void setLog(Boolean option)
      Set the log boolean true or false.
      Parameters:
      option - can be set to true or false

    • constrain

      public static float constrain(float value, float min, float max)
      Constrains a value to be within a specified range.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to be constrained.
      min - The minimum value of the range.
      max - The maximum value of the range.
      Returns:
      The constrained value within the specified range.

    • normalize

      public static float normalize(float value, float start, float stop)
      Normalizes a value to be within a specified range.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to be normalized.
      start - The start of the range.
      stop - The end of the range.
      Returns:
      The normalized value within the specified range.

    • reMap

      public static float reMap(float value, float start1, float stop1, float start2, float stop2)
      maps the input value from the input range (start1 to stop1 to the output range (start2 to stop2).
      Parameters:
      value - : the value to be mapped.
      start1 - : the lower bound of the input range.
      stop1 - : the upper bound of the input range.
      start2 - : the lower bound of the output range.
      stop2 - : the upper bound of the output range.
      Returns:
      The remapped value from the input range to the output range.

    • sawWave

      public static float sawWave(float time)
      Generates a sawtooth wave and returns linear values between 0 and 1 based on the provided time.
      Parameters:
      time - The time value.
      Returns:
      The value of the sawtooth wave.

    • counter

      public float counter(float ct, float delay, String type)
      Updates the count based on the specified motion type, current count, and delay.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of motion ("loop", "alternate", or "static").
      ct - The current count value.
      delay - The delay for the motion.
      Returns:
      The normalized count based on the specified motion type and delay.

    • in

      public final float in(float inputCt, float start, float end, String type)
      Calculates the easing progress using the ease-in-exponential algorithm.
      Parameters:
      inputCt - The input value between 0 and 1, represents the progress of the motion.
      start - The start value.
      end - The end value.
      type - Which kind of motion
      Returns:
      The eased progress between start and end.

    • out
